intro: Hieracium dovrense subsp. fellmanii, commonly known as the Fellman's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically features basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, with flowering stems that bear yellow ray florets. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its ecological niche, supporting its role in local ecosystems.
